etymology.description: Pictogram — originally a carriage seen from above; 车 is from the cursive script of 車.
etymology.interpretation: A top-down depiction of a cart: two wheels and a central frame, later regularized into vertical strokes. The simplified 车 follows a cursive shorthand of 車, keeping the overall outline while dropping interior detail.
etymology.simplification: Derived from the cursive form of 車 and adopted as a simplified shape to reduce strokes and ease writing.

examples.chinese: 我买了一辆新车(我買了一輛新車)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yī liàng xīn chē.

examples.chinese: 这条路上车很多(這條路上車很多)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo lù shàng chē hěn duō.
examples.english: There are many vehicles on this road.

examples.chinese: 火车八点到站(火車八點到站)。
